thread.title: CureJoy raises $1.15 million from Accel Partners
thread.title_full: CureJoy raises $1.15 million from Accel Partners

title: CureJoy raises $1.15 million from Accel Partners
text: CureJoy raises $1.15 million from Accel Partners Shalina Pillai Shalina Pillai ,TNN | Sep 18, 2015, 03.17 PM IST Bengaluru-based CureJoy, a content publishing and aggregation platform, will use the $1.15 million to expand its services globally. RELATED BENGALURU: Bengaluru-based healthcare startup, CureJoy has raised $1.15 million in Pre-Series A round, led by Accel Partners, India. Other investors include Venk Krishnan, founder of Nuware Technologies, and Larry Braitman, the founder of Flycast and Adify. The fund will be used by CureJoy to expand its services globally. The brainchild of Dikshant Dave and Shrinivasa Sharma, CureJoy, a content publishing and aggregation platform, was started in October 2013 to address the common concerns of people in the existing healthcare system. The platform provides curated content through its backend algorithms and technology on natural health and wellness by experts usually associated with large universities like Stanford or UCLA and merges it with the global trends and patterns. CureJoy is headquartered in California, USA and manages the entire operations and development from Bangalore. CureJoy has, so far, received two rounds of investments by Accel Partners, India and Independent Angels based out of US and India. The other players in the healthcare segment include HealthifyMe, Truweight, and Flexipass.
